content.raw:
> direct access to ign-physics or ign-rendering to users or indirect access through the ECS?

Agreed with the whole comment and that we may need to have both eventually. I'm leaning towards starting with a pure ECS approach for Acropolis, where we don't offer convenient wrappers yet, and target  interface improvements for Ign-B. This would allow us to have an initial proof of concept for distributed simulation and more experience with the system so we can make better informed decisions later.

> each sensor will need to render its own view any way

Sure, each sensor will render one view, but I was imagining that the scene tree of each runner would only include objects which are within a certain range. Are you suggesting that every system that uses ign-rendering will always have the scene tree of the whole world loaded in memory?
